channel.title: Left Inverse on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Left Inverse on Amit Rajan

item.title: Left, Right and Pseudo Inverses
item.description: 28.1 Left and Right Inverses For any matrix $A$, there are four fundamental subspaces: Row Space, Null Space, Column Space, Null Space of $A^T$. Row Space and Null Space combined span entire $\mathbb{R}^n$ for a $m \times n$ matrix $A$. Column Space and Null Space of $A^T$ combined span entire $\mathbb{R}^m$ for a $m \times n$ matrix $A$. For the inverse of the matrix to exist, it’s rank should be $r=m=n$ whtere the dimension of the matrix is $m \times n$.
